fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.basic_cs.ports

Class URIProviderInboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.basic_cs.ports.URIProviderInboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIProviderI, ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, InboundPortI, PortI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class URIProviderInboundPort
extends AbstractInboundPort
implements URIProviderI
    The class URIProviderInboundPort defines the inbound port exposing the interface URIProviderI for components of type URIProvider.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2014-01-22

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

      • URIProviderInboundPort

        public URIProviderInboundPort(java.lang.String uri,
                              ComponentI owner)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        create the port under some given URI and for a given owner. The constructor for AbstractInboundPort requires the interface that the port is implementing as an instance of java.lang.CLass, but this is statically known so the constructor does not need to receive the information as parameter.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null and owner instanceof URIProvider
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI under which the port will be published.
        owner - component owning the port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

        public java.lang.String[] provideURIs(int numberOfRequestedURIs)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: URIProviderI
        return an array of URIs each considered as a string.

 post   ret != null and ret.length == numberOfRequestedURIs
 post   forall i in 0..numberOfRequestedURIs-1, ret[i] != null
